title: Magic penetration early game
body: I recently saw monte cristo commentating on an LCK game where he have KTs' mid laner (viktor) a lot of smack for building a void staff after he upgraded his boots (3rd item) rather than a lich bane.  He said it is a bad use of gold and magic pen was unnecessary because the enemy team had low amounts of mr. So why is it okay for rumble to build haunting guise first item(+15 magic pen off the top of my head) and not okay for a mid laner to build magic pen? Thanks!

replies.body:
The difference is that Rumble is building FLAT magic pen, and that the Viktor was building PERCENTAGE magic pen, 35% pen is great, but using it against people who only have 50 magic resist doesn't do much (your getting about 15-20 pen)

Building Void staff should only be done if your needing to be doing damage to tanks that have 100+ MR, it's very possible the caster didn't take into account that the tanks were about to build their magic resist items.

Yep, I think Jason has the answer.

Flat magic pen (like Haunting Guise): Good in situations where the other team doesn't have much MR
Precentage magic pen (like LW): Good in situations where the other team does have a lot of MR

In case you are curious, if you have both types of penetration (flat and %), then the flat penetration gets applied AFTER the % penetration. So it is still good to buy LW after you already have a haunting guise, as they will be applied in the correct order (if they were applied in the opposite order, the flat pen would be almost meaningless).
